meanings.definition: A person or thing that strikes or hits forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The thwackers on the drum set made a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player swung the thwackers with all his might.
meanings.sent3: The thwackers in the action movie were the heroes who defeated the villains.
meanings.sent4: The thwackers of the storm against the windows sounded like a fierce battle.
meanings.sent5: The thwackers in the haunted house were so scary, they made everyone jump.

meanings.definition: A sound made by a forceful blow.
meanings.sent1: The thwackers of the hammer hitting the nail echoed in the room.
meanings.sent2: The thwackers of the thunder could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The thwackers of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The thwackers of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The thwackers of the drumsticks on the drum created a rhythmic beat.

meanings.sent1: He thwackers the ball with all his strength.
meanings.sent2: She thwackers the nail into the wall with precision.
meanings.sent3: The chef thwackers the dough to make the perfect pizza crust.
meanings.sent4: The waves thwackers against the shore during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The boxer thwackers his opponent with a powerful punch.
